title: Optimization Demo
description: This demo uses scipy.optimize.minimize to find a local minimum of a mathematical function (Himmelblau's function). Optimization algorithms like this are fundamental building blocks in training many machine learning models (e.g., minimizing a loss function).

title: Django Security Demo
description: Building secure web applications is crucial. Django includes several built-in features to protect against common web vulnerabilities "out-of-the-box". Here's an overview of how Django helps keep this portfolio site secure:

title: Django Testing Demo
description: Writing automated tests is crucial for building reliable and maintainable applications. Django includes a powerful testing framework based on Python's `unittest` module to help verify that different parts of your code work as expected. This prevents regressions when you add new features or refactor existing code.

title: AI Tools Demo
description: AI tools like Large Language Models (LLMs) and code assistants (e.g., GitHub Copilot, ChatGPT) are rapidly changing development workflows. They offer huge potential, but also introduce many risks, especially depending on the user's experience level.

title: Python Concepts Demo
description: Python's fundamental concepts are the building blocks for everything in data science and machine learning. This demo interactively showcases a few key ideas.

title: R Concepts Demo
description: Alongside Python, R is a powerful language and environment specifically designed for statistical computing and graphics. It's widely used by statisticians and data analysts, particularly in academia and fields like bioinformatics.

title: Go Concepts Demo
description: While Python dominates core ML model development, Go (Golang) is increasingly used for building the performant infrastructure and backend services that support ML/AI systems. Its strengths lie in simplicity, concurrency, and speed.

title: Scala Concepts Demo
description: While Python is the primary language for most ML/DS model development, Scala plays a significant role in the Big Data ecosystem, particularly as the native language of Apache Spark.

title: Java Concepts Demo
description: Java is a robust, object-oriented, platform-independent language widely used in large enterprise systems and forming the backbone of much of the Big Data ecosystem (like Hadoop and parts of Spark).

title: Security in ML, AI & Data Science

title: Data Wrangling
description: Upload a small CSV file (with headers) to see some common data wrangling steps applied, such as handling missing values, renaming columns, and creating a new feature.
